title: 7.3 A Randomized Version of Quicksort
content:
Section 7.3

A Randomized Version of Quicksort

Summary

Randomize pivot selection to avoid worst-case on any specific input.

Key Points

  • Pick pivot randomly instead of always using last element
  • Expected time O(n log n) for ANY input
  • No adversary can construct worst-case input
  • Simple change: swap random element with A[r] before partition

Pseudocode

RANDOMIZED-PARTITION(A, p, r):
    i = RANDOM(p, r)
    swap A[i] and A[r]
    return PARTITION(A, p, r)

Why It Matters

Makes quicksort robust against adversarial inputs.
